00025 /*! \file geom_utils.h
00026  *  Geometric utility functions.
00027  *
00028  *  Copyright (C) 2003, 2006 Max-Planck-Society
00029  *  \author Martin Reinecke
00030  *  \author Reinhard Hell
00031  */
00032 
00033 #ifndef PLANCK_GEOM_UTILS_H
00034 #define PLANCK_GEOM_UTILS_H
00035 
00036 #include "cxxutils.h"
00037 #include "vec3.h"
00038 
00039 /*! Returns the orientation when looking from point \a loc on the unit
00040     sphere in the direction \a dir. \a loc must be normalized. The result
00041     ranges from -pi to pi, is 0 for North and pi/2 for West, i.e. the angle
00042     is given in mathematically positive sense.
00043 
00044     If \a loc is the North or South pole, the returned angle is
00045     \a atan2(dir.y,dir.x). */
00046 inline double orientation (const vec3 &loc, const vec3 &dir)
00047   {
00048 // FIXME: here is still optimization potential
00049   if (loc.x==0 && loc.y==0)
00050     return (loc.z>0) ? safe_atan2(dir.y,-dir.x) : safe_atan2(dir.y,dir.x);
00051   vec3 east (-loc.y, loc.x, 0);
00052   vec3 north = crossprod(loc,east);
00053   return safe_atan2(-dotprod(dir,east),dotprod(dir,north));
00054   }
00055 
00056 /*! Returns the angle between \a v1 and \a v2 in radians. */
00057 inline double v_angle (const vec3 &v1, const vec3 &v2)
00058   { return atan2 (crossprod(v1,v2).Length(), dotprod(v1,v2)); }
00059 
00060 #endif
